bibl.title: Despatch from S. S. Sevier to James D. Porter, October 16, 1886
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Mr. S. S. Sevier to the Assistant Secy. State

Reception of Diplomatic series sosq and 10. Transit allowance to the widow of the late Minster, granted by order of Department of State. Attention called to complaint against consular Agent at Elmina.
Diplomatic series, Transit allowance, Complaint against consular Agent at Elmina (Gold Coast).
Hon. James D. Porter Secy of State Washington D.C.

Sir: I have the honor to inform you that Diplomatic Consular series sosq and 10 welr. received and transit allowance in favor of the widow of the late Minister Resident and Consul Moses A. Hopkins granted.
In regard to the complaint against the Agent
Agent at Elmina Gold Coast of which your enclosure No. 224 of the Vice Consul at Sierra Leone fully states, will receive my immediate attention.
I am Sir your obedient Servant
Hon. Jas. D. Porter Assistant Secy. State Washington D.C.
